Dynamic Languages Symposium (DLS)

Dynamic Languages Symposium 2008  

Co-located with ECOOP 2008

In cooperation with AITO

In cooperation with ACM SIGPLAN

Paphos, Cyprus, July 8, 2008

http://www.dynamic-languages-symposium.org/dls-08/

  • Presentations of invited talks available here!
  • DLS 2008 papers available for download from the ACM Digital Library!

The Dynamic Languages Symposium (DLS) is a forum for discussion of dynamic languages, their implementation and application. While mature dynamic languages including Smalltalk, Lisp, Scheme, Self, and Prolog continue to grow and inspire new converts, a new generation of dynamic scripting languages such as Python, Ruby, PHP, Tcl and JavaScript are successful in a wide range of applications. DLS provides a place for researchers and practitioners to come together and share their knowledge, experience, and ideas for future research and development. This 4th edition of the symposium received 14 submissions of which 6 high quality papers were accepted. The program committee reviewed each paper and met electronically to select papers for the final program. In addition, the DLS 2008 is proud to present invited talks by Dan Ingalls, Laurence Tratt and Rich Hickey.

Johan Brichau
DLS 2008 Program Chair
Université Catholique de Louvain
Belgium
